data.event: Logan is situated on the Gallatin River and was established in 1889 as a railroad station on the Northern Pacific and Montana (later the Northern Pacific Railway).
(Logan is located on today's Montana Rail Link.) During construction period the settlement was referred to as Canyon House, due to a house of that name which was here at that time.
The name of Logan was adopted on November 26, 1889.
The name is in honor of Captain William Logan, who came to Montana in 1872, taking part in General Bakerâ€™s campaign against the Indians in 1872 to 1876.
In 1877, Captain Logan accompanied General Gibbon on the expedition which resulted in the Battle of the Big Hole on August 9, 1877, where he met his death.

event.title: resulted in the Battle of the Big Hole on August 9, 1877

data.event: In 1877, Captain Logan accompanied General Gibbon on the expedition which resulted in the Battle of the Big Hole on August 9, 1877, where he met his death.
The plat was filed on June 10, 1893.
